sentences.text: on the named page, found here:
there is a link with a file:// URL, which is illegal in this context.
Thanks for your report, reassigning it to the proper package.
> on the named page, found here:
> there is a link with a file:// URL, which is illegal in this > context.
Do you have any advice for an appropriate URL, which already works from the HTML version of the installed package, but indeed not from the www.d.o copy?
> I tried to poke around w.d.o a bit to find a link that would have been > something like
Sure, the git-buildpackage documentation is not (yet) shipped in the website, and the online copy [0] doesn't seems to be automatically updated.
Guido, do you intend to maintain an online and up to date copy of the git-buildpackage documentation somewhere?
What does the documentation team think about shipping this documentation in the doc part of the website, if Guido agrees?
(I can take care of the shipping if none disagree).
On Sat, Oct 22, 2011 at 11:10:24PM -0400, David Prvot wrote:
> > on the named page, found here:
> > there is a link with a file:// URL, which is illegal in this > > context.
> > I tried to poke around w.d.o a bit to find a link that would have been > > something like
No, I meant it to be file://...
If you are using Debian (which I expect for reader for maint-guide), you can install package to your system and read it using epiphany as browser as here.
(I know some browser like chromium does not allow local file link ...
> Sure, the git-buildpackage documentation is not (yet) shipped in the > website, and the online copy [0] doesn't seems to be automatically updated.
> Guido, do you intend to maintain an online and up to date copy of the > git-buildpackage documentation somewhere?
I do not think this is scalable idea.
But having documentation pages of packaged softwares to be exposed to the public itself is interesting idea.
> What does the documentation team think about shipping this documentation > in the doc part of the website, if Guido agrees?
If we do this, we should design this welll.
* How should we manage DDP on Debian web server and DDP contents?
* What is the best web documentation resource arrangement now?
* How do we split role with semi-static DDP page and Wiki page?
* CVS+DDP build was good way to be current.
* XML/SGML + PO4A, internationalization is very good.
* unstable package build environment is usually better than DDP     build machine.
* Pakage and web page build difference is annoying sometimes and what     we want now is more like /usr/share/doc/<packagename> contents.
* Already grown into more resourceful than DDP for *current* issues.
* Easy entry with quick result => current content better than SVN
* translation synching is not best but getting better.
If we can publish all the documentation contents on the web with stable URL exposed via something similar to the dhelp or dwww consistently, it will be nice.
(There are some measures needed for transition.)
In order to avoid package conflict issue of actual installation, we may need to install only documentation contents of packages files with non-standard way.
(I can take care of the shipping if none > disagree).
On Sat, 22 Oct 2011, David Prvot wrote:
> What does the documentation team think about shipping this documentation > in the doc part of the website, if Guido agrees?
I don't think it makes much sense.
We have many Debian specific tools whose documentation is not on www.debian.org.
I don't see what would make git-buildpackage different from the lintian manual, or the svn-buildpackage manual.
The documentation is already embedded in the package and that's where we expect people to get it from usually.
Pre-order a copy of the Debian Administrator's Handbook and help liberate it: http://debian-handbook.info/go/ulule-rh/
> On Sat, 22 Oct 2011, David Prvot wrote:
>> What does the documentation team think about shipping this documentation >> in the doc part of the website, if Guido agrees?
> I don't think it makes much sense.
We have many Debian specific tools > whose documentation is not on www.debian.org.
> I don't see what would make git-buildpackage different from the lintian > manual, or the svn-buildpackage manual.
> The documentation is already embedded in the package and that's where we > expect people to get it from usually.
The reason for wanting to read it online is that I assumed that there might be a newer version online (the one from sid, as opposed to the one from stable), than on disk.
But completely independently from this problem, file:// URLs are - afaik
- forbidden due to their security effects (what if JavaScript would eg.
I tried with Firefox and Opera, and neither opened that link from the web page.
This means that all such links will be dead, from the user experience.
[ Copy of Guido's answer to the bug log ]
> On Sat, Oct 22, 2011 at 11:10:24PM -0400, David Prvot wrote:
> the online copy [0] doesn't seems to be automatically updated.
> Guido, do you intend to maintain an online and up to date copy of the > git-buildpackage documentation somewhere?
>> The information at the above URL is usually up to date.
I should do a >> better job of updating it although nothing changed significantly.
>> I'll add this to the upload script.
We believe that the bug you reported is fixed in the latest version of maint-guide, which is due to be installed in the Debian FTP archive:
A summary of the changes between this version and the previous one is attached.
Thank you for reporting the bug, which will now be closed.
If you have further comments please address them to 646283@bugs.debian.org, and the maintainer will reopen the bug report if appropriate.
Osamu Aoki <osamu@debian.org> (supplier of updated maint-guide package)
(This message was generated automatically at their request;
if you believe that there is a problem with it please contact the archive administrators by mailing ftpmaster@debian.org)
Binary: maint-guide maint-guide-ca maint-guide-es maint-guide-fr maint-guide-it maint-guide-ja maint-guide-ru
* Promoted new dh_python2 while deprecating older python-support and      python-central. Closes: #633112
* Substituted New Maintainer site with New Member site.  Thanks      Salvatore Bonaccorso. Closes: #648834
* Removed all URL references with file:///... . Closes: #646283
* Fixed pbuilder hook script bugs caused by the XML conversion      of the old buggy debiandoc-sgml. Closes: #637928, #642599
* Add Russian.  Thanks Yuri Kozlov. Closes: #646330
* Build: en ca es fr it ja ru
